  16. (* Extensible buffers *)

  18. (* The [inner_buffer] type ensures that the [length] and [buffer] fields are
  19.    always synchronized, [length = Bytes.length buffer], even in presence
  20.    of data races.
  21. *)
  22. ‌type inner_buffer = {
  23.   buffer: bytes;
  24.   length: int;
  25. }

  27. ‌type t =
  28. {mutable inner : inner_buffer;
  29.   mutable position : int;
  30.   initial_buffer : bytes}
  31. (* Invariants: all parts of the code preserve the invariants that:
  32.    - [inner.length = Bytes.length inner.buffer]
  33.    In absence of data races, we also have
  34.    - [0 <= b.position <= b.inner.length]

  36.    Note in particular that [b.position = b.inner.length] is legal,
  37.    it means that the buffer is full and will have to be extended
  38.    before any further addition. *)

  40. ‌let create n =
  41. let n = if n < 1 then 1 else n in
  42. ‌ let n = if n > Sys.max_string_length then Sys.max_string_length else n in
  43. ‌ let s = Bytes.create n in
  44. { inner = { buffer = s; length = n}; position = 0; initial_buffer = s}

  46. ‌let contents b = Bytes.sub_string b.inner.buffer 0 b.position
  47. ‌let to_bytes b = Bytes.sub b.inner.buffer 0 b.position

  49. ‌let sub b ofs len =
  50.   if ofs < 0 || len < 0 || ofs > b.position - len
  51.   then invalid_arg "Buffer.sub"
  52.   else Bytes.sub_string b.inner.buffer ofs len


  55. ‌let blit src srcoff dst dstoff len =
  56.   if len < 0 || srcoff < 0 || srcoff > src.position - len
  57.              || dstoff < 0 || dstoff > (Bytes.length dst) - len
  58.   then invalid_arg "Buffer.blit"
  59.   else
  60.     Bytes.blit src.inner.buffer srcoff dst dstoff len


  63. ‌let nth b ofs =
  64.   let position = b.position in
  65.   let {buffer;length} = b.inner in
  66.   if ofs < 0 || ofs >= position || position > length then
  67.    invalid_arg "Buffer.nth"
  68.   else Bytes.unsafe_get buffer ofs


  71. ‌let length b = b.position

  73. ‌let clear b = b.position <- 0

  75. ‌let reset b =
  76.   b.position <- 0;
  77.   let inner =
  78.     { buffer = b.initial_buffer; length = Bytes.length b.initial_buffer }
  79.   in
  80.   b.inner <- inner

  82. (* [resize b more] ensures that [b.position + more <= b.inner.length] holds
  83.    by dynamically extending [b.inner] if necessary -- and thus
  84.    increasing [b.inner.length].
  85. *)
  86. ‌let resize b more =
  87.   let old_pos = b.position in
  88.   let old_len = b.inner.length in
  89.   let new_len = ref old_len in
  90.   while old_pos + more > !new_len do new_len := 2 * !new_len done;
  91.   if !new_len > Sys.max_string_length then begin
  92.     if old_pos + more <= Sys.max_string_length
  93.     then new_len := Sys.max_string_length
  94.     else failwith "Buffer.add: cannot grow buffer"
  95.   end;
  96. ‌  let new_buffer = Bytes.create !new_len in
  97.   (* PR#6148: let's keep using [blit] rather than [unsafe_blit] in
  98.      this tricky function that is slow anyway. *)
  99.   Bytes.blit b.inner.buffer 0 new_buffer 0 b.position;
  100.   b.inner <- { buffer = new_buffer; length = !new_len }

  102. (* Note:
  103.     Some of the functions below have a fast path when the inner
  104.   buffer doesn't need to be extended.
  105.     In this case, it is possible to use unsafe accesses on the
  106.   contents of the [inner] field since its fields are immutable.
  107.   In presence of data races, we may access the wrong inner buffer, but we
  108.   will use this buffer safely.
  109.   As soon as we need to resize the buffer, we fall back to safe accesses.
  110. *)

  112. ‌let add_char b c =
  113.   let pos = b.position in
  114.   let {buffer;length} = b.inner in
  115.   if pos >= length then (
  116.     resize b 1;
  117.     Bytes.set b.inner.buffer b.position c
  118.   ) else
  119.     Bytes.unsafe_set buffer pos c;
  120.   b.position <- pos + 1

  122. ‌let uchar_utf_8_byte_length_max = 4
  123. ‌let uchar_utf_16_byte_length_max = 4

  125. ‌let rec add_utf_8_uchar b u =
  126.   let pos = b.position in
  127.   if pos >= b.inner.length then resize b uchar_utf_8_byte_length_max;
  128.   let n = Bytes.set_utf_8_uchar b.inner.buffer pos u in
  129.   if n = 0
  130.   then (resize b uchar_utf_8_byte_length_max; add_utf_8_uchar b u)
  131.   else (b.position <- pos + n)

  133. ‌let rec add_utf_16be_uchar b u =
  134.   let pos = b.position in
  135.   if pos >= b.inner.length then resize b uchar_utf_16_byte_length_max;
  136.   let n = Bytes.set_utf_16be_uchar b.inner.buffer pos u in
  137.   if n = 0
  138.   then (resize b uchar_utf_16_byte_length_max; add_utf_16be_uchar b u)
  139.   else (b.position <- pos + n)

  141. ‌let rec add_utf_16le_uchar b u =
  142.   let pos = b.position in
  143.   if pos >= b.inner.length then resize b uchar_utf_16_byte_length_max;
  144.   let n = Bytes.set_utf_16le_uchar b.inner.buffer pos u in
  145.   if n = 0
  146.   then (resize b uchar_utf_16_byte_length_max; add_utf_16le_uchar b u)
  147.   else (b.position <- pos + n)

  149. ‌let add_substring b s offset len =
  150.   if offset < 0 || len < 0 || offset > String.length s - len
  151.   then invalid_arg "Buffer.add_substring/add_subbytes";
  152.   let position = b.position in
  153.   let {buffer;length} = b.inner in
  154. ‌  let new_position = position + len in
  155.   if new_position > length then (
  156.     resize b len;
  157.     Bytes.blit_string s offset b.inner.buffer b.position len
  158.   ) else
  159.     Bytes.unsafe_blit_string s offset buffer position len;
  160.   b.position <- new_position

  162. ‌let add_subbytes b s offset len =
  163.   add_substring b (Bytes.unsafe_to_string s) offset len

  165. ‌let add_string b s =
  166.   let len = String.length s in
  167.   let position = b.position in
  168.   let {buffer; length} = b.inner in
  169. ‌  let new_position = position + len in
  170.   if new_position > length then (
  171.     resize b len;
  172.     Bytes.blit_string s 0 b.inner.buffer b.position len;
  173.   ) else
  174.     Bytes.unsafe_blit_string s 0 buffer position len;
  175.   b.position <- new_position

  177. ‌let add_bytes b s = add_string b (Bytes.unsafe_to_string s)

  179. ‌let add_buffer b bs =
  180.   add_subbytes b bs.inner.buffer 0 bs.position

  182. (* this (private) function could move into the standard library *)
  183. ‌let really_input_up_to ic buf ofs len =
  184.   let rec loop ic buf ~already_read ~ofs ~to_read =
  185.     if to_read = 0 then already_read
  186.     else begin
  187.       let r = input ic buf ofs to_read in
  188.       if r = 0 then already_read
  189.       else begin
  190.         let already_read = already_read + r in
  191.         let ofs = ofs + r in
  192.         let to_read = to_read - r in
  193.         loop ic buf ~already_read ~ofs ~to_read
  194.       end
  195.     end
  196.   in loop ic buf ~already_read:0 ~ofs ~to_read:len


  199. ‌let unsafe_add_channel_up_to b ic len =
  200.   if b.position + len > b.inner.length then resize b len;
  201.   let n = really_input_up_to ic b.inner.buffer b.position len in
  202.   b.position <- b.position + n;
  203.   n

  205. ‌let add_channel b ic len =
  206.   if len < 0 || len > Sys.max_string_length then   (* PR#5004 *)
  207.     invalid_arg "Buffer.add_channel";
  208.   let n = unsafe_add_channel_up_to b ic len in
  209.   (* It is intentional that a consumer catching End_of_file
  210.      will see the data written (see #6719, #7136). *)
  211.   if n < len then raise End_of_file;
  212.   ()

  214. ‌let output_buffer oc b =
  215.   output oc b.inner.buffer 0 b.position

  217. ‌let closing = function
  218.   | '(' -> ')'
  219.   | '{' -> '}'
  220.   | _ -> assert false

  222. (* opening and closing: open and close characters, typically ( and )
  223.    k: balance of opening and closing chars
  224.    s: the string where we are searching
  225.    start: the index where we start the search. *)
  226. ‌let advance_to_closing opening closing k s start =
  227.   let rec advance k i lim =
  228.     if i >= lim then raise Not_found else
  229.     if s.[i] = opening then advance (k + 1) (i + 1) lim else
  230.     if s.[i] = closing then
  231.       if k = 0 then i else advance (k - 1) (i + 1) lim
  232.     else advance k (i + 1) lim in
  233.   advance k start (String.length s)

  235. ‌let advance_to_non_alpha s start =
  236.   let rec advance i lim =
  237.     if i >= lim then lim else
  238.     match s.[i] with
  239.     | 'a' .. 'z' | 'A' .. 'Z' | '0' .. '9' | '_' -> advance (i + 1) lim
  240.     | _ -> i in
  241.   advance start (String.length s)

  243. (* We are just at the beginning of an ident in s, starting at start. *)
  244. ‌let find_ident s start lim =
  245.   if start >= lim then raise Not_found else
  246.   match s.[start] with
  247.   (* Parenthesized ident ? *)
  248.   | '(' | '{' as c ->
  249.      let new_start = start + 1 in
  250.      let stop = advance_to_closing c (closing c) 0 s new_start in
  251.      String.sub s new_start (stop - start - 1), stop + 1
  252.   (* Regular ident *)
  253.   | _ ->
  254.      let stop = advance_to_non_alpha s (start + 1) in
  255.      String.sub s start (stop - start), stop

  257. (* Substitute $ident, $(ident), or ${ident} in s,
  258.     according to the function mapping f. *)
  259. ‌let add_substitute b f s =
  260.   let lim = String.length s in
  261.   let rec subst previous i =
  262.     if i < lim then begin
  263.       match s.[i] with
  264.       | '$' as current when previous = '\\' ->
  265.          add_char b current;
  266.          subst ' ' (i + 1)
  267.       | '$' ->
  268.          let j = i + 1 in
  269.          let ident, next_i = find_ident s j lim in
  270.          add_string b (f ident);
  271.          subst ' ' next_i
  272.       | current when previous == '\\' ->
  273.          add_char b '\\';
  274.          add_char b current;
  275.          subst ' ' (i + 1)
  276.       | '\\' as current ->
  277.          subst current (i + 1)
  278.       | current ->
  279.          add_char b current;
  280.          subst current (i + 1)
  281.     end else
  282.     if previous = '\\' then add_char b previous in
  283.   subst ' ' 0

  285. ‌let truncate b len =
  286.     if len < 0 || len > length b then
  287.       invalid_arg "Buffer.truncate"
  288.     else
  289.       b.position <- len

  291. (** {1 Iterators} *)

  293. ‌let to_seq b =
  294.   let rec aux i () =
  295.     (* Note that b.position is not a constant and cannot be lifted out of aux *)
  296.     if i >= b.position then Seq.Nil
  297.     else
  298.       let x = Bytes.get b.inner.buffer i in
  299.       Seq.Cons (x, aux (i+1))
  300.   in
  301.   aux 0

  303. ‌let to_seqi b =
  304.   let rec aux i () =
  305.     (* Note that b.position is not a constant and cannot be lifted out of aux *)
  306.     if i >= b.position then Seq.Nil
  307.     else
  308.       let x = Bytes.get b.inner.buffer i in
  309.       Seq.Cons ((i,x), aux (i+1))
  310.   in
  311.   aux 0

  313. ‌let add_seq b seq = Seq.iter (add_char b) seq

  315. ‌let of_seq i =
  316.   let b = create 32 in
  317.   add_seq b i;
  318.   b

  320. (** {6 Binary encoding of integers} *)

  322. external unsafe_set_int8 : bytes -> int -> int -> unit = "%bytes_unsafe_set"
  323. external unsafe_set_int16 : bytes -> int -> int -> unit = "%caml_bytes_set16u"
  324. external unsafe_set_int32 : bytes -> int -> int32 -> unit = "%caml_bytes_set32u"
  325. external unsafe_set_int64 : bytes -> int -> int64 -> unit = "%caml_bytes_set64u"
  326. external set_int8 : bytes -> int -> int -> unit = "%bytes_safe_set"
  327. external set_int16 : bytes -> int -> int -> unit = "%caml_bytes_set16"
  328. external set_int32 : bytes -> int -> int32 -> unit = "%caml_bytes_set32"
  329. external set_int64 : bytes -> int -> int64 -> unit = "%caml_bytes_set64"

  331. external swap16 : int -> int = "%bswap16"
  332. external swap32 : int32 -> int32 = "%bswap_int32"
  333. external swap64 : int64 -> int64 = "%bswap_int64"


  336. ‌let add_int8 b x =
  337.   let position = b.position in
  338.   let {length; buffer} = b.inner in
  339. ‌  let new_position = position + 1 in
  340.   if new_position > length then (
  341.     resize b 1;
  342.     set_int8 b.inner.buffer b.position x
  343.   ) else
  344.     unsafe_set_int8 buffer position x;
  345.   b.position <- new_position

  347. ‌let add_int16_ne b x =
  348.   let position = b.position in
  349.   let {length; buffer} = b.inner in
  350. ‌  let new_position = position + 2 in
  351.   if new_position > length then (
  352.     resize b 2;
  353.     set_int16 b.inner.buffer b.position x
  354.   ) else
  355.     unsafe_set_int16 buffer position x;
  356.   b.position <- new_position

  358. ‌let add_int32_ne b x =
  359.   let position = b.position in
  360.   let {length; buffer} = b.inner in
  361. ‌  let new_position = position + 4 in
  362.   if new_position > length then (
  363.     resize b 4;
  364.     set_int32 b.inner.buffer b.position x
  365.   ) else
  366.     unsafe_set_int32 buffer position x;
  367.   b.position <- new_position

  369. ‌let add_int64_ne b x =
  370.   let position = b.position in
  371.   let {length; buffer} = b.inner in
  372. ‌  let new_position = position + 8 in
  373.   if new_position > length then (
  374.     resize b 8;
  375.     set_int64 b.inner.buffer b.position x
  376.   ) else
  377.     unsafe_set_int64 buffer position x;
  378.   b.position <- new_position

  380. ‌let add_int16_le b x =
  381.   add_int16_ne b (if Sys.big_endian then swap16 x else x)

  383. ‌let add_int16_be b x =
  384.   add_int16_ne b (if Sys.big_endian then x else swap16 x)

  386. ‌let add_int32_le b x =
  387.   add_int32_ne b (if Sys.big_endian then swap32 x else x)

  389. ‌let add_int32_be b x =
  390.   add_int32_ne b (if Sys.big_endian then x else swap32 x)

  392. ‌let add_int64_le b x =
  393.   add_int64_ne b (if Sys.big_endian then swap64 x else x)

  395. ‌let add_int64_be b x =
  396.   add_int64_ne b (if Sys.big_endian then x else swap64 x)

  398. ‌let add_uint8 = add_int8
  399. ‌let add_uint16_ne = add_int16_ne
  400. ‌let add_uint16_le = add_int16_le
  401. ‌let add_uint16_be = add_int16_be
